transcripts.text: How you doing?
Good, how you doing?
Not too bad.
What can I do for you?
Well, we had a call that you were recording trains or something.  I don't know for sure what it is.
Well, I don't know what it is, boy, but I'm going to find out.
Okay.
Is there any reason why you're over here?  Is that what you're doing?
Well, I don't know.
You don't know what you're doing?
No, I don't know that I need to explain to you what I'm doing.
Well, you're on private property.
Are you assuming I don't have permission to be here?
Do you have permission to be here?
Do I not?
We got a call on you, a complaint, okay?
Okay.
That's why I'm here.  All right.  All right.  I'm off duty.  I'm just trying to help out right now, okay?
I'm off duty right now, boy, but I'm just here to help out, which in layman's terms means I'm going to violate your rights.
Okay.
So do you have any ID or anything?
I do.
Okay, can I see your ID, sir?
I'm being detained.
No, sir, you're not being detained.
Well, officer, if I'm not being detained and you is asking me for my identification, you, sir, are violating my rights as a free American.  Why are you so stupid?
I'd rather not answer any more questions.  You're inside a vehicle.
Listen, officer, this is not a vehicle I am sitting in.  This is a watermelon that I'm peeking my head out of.
Yes, sir.  Yes, sir.  Are you planning to run my plates?  You know that's illegal?  Uh, nothing as far as I'm concerned.
Well, did he tell you why we got a call on you?
He said he got a call on me.  Yeah.
You guys are taking pictures or whatever?
Yes, sir.  I am taking pictures of whatevers because I stopped taking pictures of so what's and I don't cares.
Yeah?  Is that illegal?
No.  It's just a little suspicious.  You're taking pictures of the gas company.
You realize that, uh, A citizen taking pictures in public is a First Amendment-protected activity, right?  Yeah.
But you understand that we're in a time of terrorism, too.  Somebody taking pictures of railroad tracks and gas company, that ain't normal.

It's not?  No.  Well, maybe not your definition of normal.  But I would hate to think that, as a law enforcement officer, that a citizen taking activity and... Doing a constitutionally protected activity that is legal would throw up a red flag in your eyes and be suspicious.
Do you have a... Do you have a right to be on this property?  Do you have permission?
I'm not answering any more questions.  You're not?  I mean, if you want to assume that I don't have a right to be on this property and pursue that, that's your business, but... Okay.
Well, we're checking right now with the owner, and if you don't, we're going to cite you for trespassing, all right?
Really?
Mm-hmm.

if the owner doesn't want you on the property.  Okay.  Is it trespassing to be on what is considered public property and public access if I haven't been asked not to be here before?  And do you think that the owner of this church Do you have a license on you?  Do you think that the owner of this church would want me to not be here unless you coerced him into not wanting me to be here?
We're not coercing.  Do you have a license on you?
I do.
Can I see him?
Is that a request or an order?
Well, it's a request.
Am I being detained?  No.  Have I committed a crime?
But you do.

Am I being accused of committing a crime?  If I stay in Kentucky, you have to produce your license with me.  Only if I'm suspected of committing a crime or in the process of committing a crime.  What's your name, sir?  If I'm not being detained, I'm not answering any more questions.
What's your name, sir?
I'm not answering any questions.  I'll give you my first and last name.  Officer.  Officer, can I ask you a question?  Am I being detained?  What crime am I being detained for?
Boy, you is being detained because you is taking pictures of whatevers.

Since this officer says now that I'm being detained, which illegally because he hasn't been able to articulate a crime that I've been detained for, I'm now obligated to provide him with some form of ID and a copy of my carry concealed license, which I have right here in my hand ready.  Just so we're all clear, I'm parked in the parking lot of a church.  These two officers are now running my license plate.  We have a third officer coming up, lights a-blazing.  He's apparently going somewhere else.  I understand that.
What makes you think that it is?

Because I'd hate to think that I live in a country where you officers could just run my plates and get my information anytime you want.  Now, given the fact that if I'm not detained, I don't have to provide ID, he did not detain me.  He just took it upon himself to go back there to find out who I am.  I do not have to provide that information to you unless I'm detained.  And you didn't detain me until you walked to the back of my car after you ran my plate and after that officer ran my plate.  I have it all on video.
That's fine.

Now, if you'd have come up and said you're detained for this crime, I'd have provided you everything you needed.  But you didn't do that.  Y'all just want to know what I'm doing.  So you want my ID, which is not the way it works.  And because I didn't?  because I didn't.  Because I didn't provide my ID, then he wants to be shady and go run my place.
Nobody's being shady.  Listen to me, sir.

Everybody's being shady here.  I haven't committed a crime.  I haven't done anything wrong.  And if you say I'm trespassing on this property, you're wrong.  Because I can't be trespassing on a property that I've never been asked to be to.  This is a church parking lot.  Are you prepared to stay in court and tell the court that this preacher of this church would not want me here?  Are you going to let me answer?  Are you going to let me answer?  Sure, go ahead.

Okay, the answer to that is we got a call that you were here, okay?  Now... We're investigating that.  For whatever reason you're here, not just because you're sitting on the church parking lot.  It wouldn't matter if you were sitting in front of Rite Aid parking lot or anything else.  It doesn't matter.

Well, if it doesn't matter where I'm sitting, why was I threatened with being charged with trespassing?  And I would appreciate it if you didn't touch me.  I know you have no ill will, but I would appreciate it if you didn't take for granted that we're friends enough for you to touch me.  Because right now you're performing an illegal act, and I don't trust you.  Well, this is not a consensual conversation.  And the only way it's going to continue to be a conversation is if I'm detained.  And if you detain me...
Well, until we figure out why... Let me tell you this.
Unless I'm being detained, I'm not answering any more questions, and I'd like to be free to go about my business.
Until we figure out why you're here, you are being detained.
Okay, what crime am I being detained for?
Suspicious activity.  Trespassing, for one.
There's a railroad here.  Now we're back to trespassing.  Yeah.
I mean, that's what it is, sir.  I'm not just pulling stuff out of my butt here.
Okay, boy.  I just lied.  I am pulling stuff out of my butt here now because I am going to be late for dinner and I want to have a little snack on the way home.

So if I was to go parking, like your example, if I was to go park in Rite Aid parking lot and sit there and take some pictures, that makes me trespassing?  Just like I'm doing here?  I'm in a church parking lot.  OK, that is openly accessible to the public.  There are no signs that say private property.  There are no signs that say you can argue.
I'm not being argumentative with you and saying that's not the case.  That's just wrong.

Exactly right.  I mean, you can charge me with trespassing all you want.  But if you think you're going to be able to stand up in court in front of a jury of my peers and convince them that what I'm doing right now is trespassing, you're wasting your time, my time and and the court's time.
Well, here's the thing.  Here's the thing.  Most 90 percent of what we do is a waste of time.
But boy, that still don't stop me from sucking the taxpayers dry.
Okay, I'll give you that.
All this boils down to is your off-duty officer that pulled up and told me he was off-duty and told me I was not detained, wanted to know who I was, and he doesn't have that right.

No, that's not what happened.  I have it all on video.  I understand.  You're right, but let me tell you, he didn't just run across you.  What happened was... He heard the radio call.  Me and that other deputy got a radio call that somebody was here taking pictures.  And he heard it on the radio and was close by and stopped.  He didn't just approach you because he felt like he was approaching you.
So nobody called and said there was somebody trespassing.  Somebody called and said I was taking pictures.  Is it illegal to take pictures in public?
It depends on what you're taking a picture of, sir.
So you're telling me that a citizen doesn't have a right in public to take a picture of anything they can see from public?  Is that what you're telling me?
Let me back that up because I'm going to use that argument.
I'd just like for you to answer my question.

Hold on.  I'm going to answer it.  Okay.  But I'm going to answer it in a way that you asked us to about running your license plate.  The courts have already said that license plate is in plain view wherever it is.  As long as we don't go up in your yard and do it.
I didn't accuse you.  I said I think it's illegal, and I'm going to find out.
And I'm explaining it to you.
Okay.  And before we leave, I'm going to need names and badge numbers from every officer that's here.  Or a business card.
Well, you're recording it.  You've got mine right here.  Okay.
What's your badge number, sir?
Thank you.  And I'm going to need it from those gentlemen as well.
So... Why can't we have a civil conversation here?
We were having a civil conversation until your officer, who was off duty and told me that I was not detained, started asking me for my ID, what I was doing, why I was here.
Okay, I'm asking you to communicate with me.

Okay.  I'll communicate as much as I feel necessary to communicate with you.  If I'm being detained, though, I need to know right now if I'm being detained.  Because if I'm being detained, I'm going to cooperate silently and I'm going to plead the fifth and not answer any more questions.  Now, if you want to have a consensual conversation and communicate, I'll do that if I'm not being detained at my discretion, not yours.  So I need to know, am I being detained for a crime?  And if so, I need you to articulate what crime I'm being detained for.
You're being questioned and talked to right now about suspicious activity.  That's the call.  That's what we have.
But am I being detained?  If I'm not being detained, I'm going to be free to go on my way.
Sir, let me...

Listen, the law says if you're detaining me, I have to cooperate within the law.  If I'm not being detained, I have every right to leave... If you do not allow me to leave and I'm not being detained, you're falsely imprisoning me.
No, I'm not falsely imprisoning you.
So am I for you to go?
No, sir.
Am I being detained?  Yes, sir.  Okay.  What crime am I being detained for?
Trespassing and suspicious activity.  That's what I'm telling you.  I told you that three times.

Suspicious activity is not a crime.  I can be suspicious if I want to.  There's nothing legal about being suspicious.  And if you're going to detain me for trespassing, I'd like for you to go ahead and cite me.
Well, we have the discretion not to.  We have the discretion to or not to.
So you're using the trespassing to get what you want when I won't cooperate.
I'm using a little bit of logic here and trying to figure out for this business owner right here.
I spoke to this business twice.  Both times I've explained to them what I do here.  Both times their management said that's okay.
When was the last time that you talked to them?
Two months ago.  I have it on video.
Do you know who that was that you spoke to?
I have it on video, his name.
Can you tell me his name so I can ask if he's over there?

I don't know it off the top of my head.  I have it on video, though.  And I'm not going to provide any information right now because I'd have to shut this video off to do so.  Now, that's not me being argumentative.  That's just a fact.  I'm not going to shut this recording.  I'm doing right now off to find out that gentleman's name.
I'm just curious about one.  Can we have a sensible conversation about one thing?  No, we can't.
You've told me I'm being detained, so as of right now, if I'm being detained, I'm not answering any more questions, and you tell me what I need to do.
What do you mean if I tell you what to do?
Well, if I'm being detained by law, I have to cooperate.  If I'm not being detained, I don't have to cooperate.
Okay, well, here's the thing.  I mean, here's what it can come down to, okay?  If you want to play this, okay?
I'm not playing anything.  I'm following the law.
I understand.
I wish we were all following the law.
And that's what I'm telling you, the law.  Okay.  Let me tell you something.  That Constitution means just as much to me as it does you.  Apparently not.
You swore an oath to protect it, and you're not right now.  That's exactly right.

Yes, absolutely, 100%.  Absolutely, 100%, sir.  And I've been protecting this Constitution since I was 17 years old in the Marine Corps and everything else in law enforcement.  So don't tell me, just because I'm a law enforcement officer, that we're tramping all over everybody's Constitution.

I'm telling you because of your actions right now.  Sir, my actions, we have a right to talk to whoever we want to.  I am taking part in a constitutionally protected activity, and you're detaining me.

Okay, well, here's what it comes down to, sir.  Here's what it comes down to.  If you want to talk to law, okay, the thing is the law is telling you don't come back on this property, don't come back on that property, or that is failure to obey an order and you can go to jail.
On what property?  You said this property?
This property, yes.
And you said that property.  What other property are we speaking of?  This property.  I've never been on that property in my life.
I'm not saying you have.  I'm just telling you.

And if you're giving me a direct order that I can't be on this property?  and I contact this individual right here, and he tells me I can be on this property, me and you are going to court.  I don't care, sir.  I know you don't care.  Well, you can't just go around telling people.
You're not a church member.
How do you know that?  Are you assuming that?
Are you a church member here?
I don't have to answer that question.
Gary, is he the preacher here?  Can he come over here?  We'll find out.
I got no problem with that.  But I bet you you do the talking to him, and when it's all said and done, let me talk to him and see how it turns out.
Do you know this individual?
No, I'm sorry, I do not.  How do you do, sir?  Is he a member of your church?
No, he's not.  Is he allowed to be on this property?

No, he's not.  Okay.  Can you tell me why I'm not allowed to be on it?  I respect your wishes, but can you tell me your reason for me not being allowed to be on this property?  I would prefer not to do that.  Okay, that's fair enough.  Have you ever told me before that I wasn't allowed on this property?  No, I have not.  Thank you for being honest.  I appreciate that.  Would you like to know why I'm on your property?  No, I would not.  Okay.  Well, that's fair enough.  Thank you.  And you don't want me coming to your church or back to your property?  You're welcome to come to services only.  Oh.  If you are doing anything other than attending our service, I will ask you to leave again.  Okay.  Fair enough.  All right.  Is that okay?
All right.  Thank you, sir.  I appreciate it.

Oh, are we done now?  Yes, sir.  I'm not being charged with trespassing?  Can I have your name and badge number, please?  It's Trevor Breyer.  Trooper Pryor, and Trooper Pryor, I'm going to ask you, you're the one that detained me.  You never did give me cause for the detention, but am I now no longer detained?  Yeah, you're free to leave.  And I'm no longer charged with trespassing and the other things you said I was going to be charged with?
No, you will be if you come back, because you've heard it from the owner, okay?  He doesn't want you here.  Okay.
No, it's not all right, but I understand that, sir.
It's the same Constitution that I've been fighting for since I was 17 years old and went in the military.
From your actions right here, you're not doing a very good job of it.
Okay, well, I appreciate that.
Because you violated about three of my constitutional rights.  Thank you.
I appreciate your citizenship.
I'm not a citizen of this city.
Okay.  Have a good day, son.
